00038 // The gfKeyState table is used to track which of the keys is up or down at any one time. This is used while polling
00039 // the interface.
00040 
00041 BOOLEAN   gfKeyState[256];                // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00042 BOOLEAN   fCursorWasClipped = FALSE;
00043 RECT      gCursorClipRect;

00047 // The gsKeyTranslationTables basically translates scan codes to our own key value table. Please note that the table is 2 bytes
00048 // wide per entry. This will be used since we will use 2 byte characters for translation purposes.
00049 
00050 UINT16   gfShiftState;                          // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00051 UINT16   gfAltState;                                  // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00052 UINT16   gfCtrlState;                                 // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00053

00055 
00056 BOOLEAN   gfTrackDblClick;
00057 UINT32    guiDoubleClkDelay;        // Current delay in milliseconds for a delay
00058 UINT32            guiSingleClickTimer;
00059 UINT32            guiRecordedWParam;

00061 UINT16            gusRecordedKeyState;
00062 BOOLEAN           gfRecordedLeftButtonUp;

00064 UINT32            guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer;
00065 UINT32            guiRightButtonRepeatTimer;

00067 BOOLEAN   gfTrackMousePos;                // TRUE = queue mouse movement events, FALSE = don't
00068 BOOLEAN   gfLeftButtonState;        // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00069 BOOLEAN   gfRightButtonState;       // TRUE = Pressed, FALSE = Not Pressed
00070 UINT16    gusMouseXPos;                         // X position of the mouse on screen
00071 UINT16    gusMouseYPos;                         // y position of the mouse on screen

00102 // These are the hook functions for both keyboard and mouse

00104 LRESULT CALLBACK KeyboardHandler(int Code, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00105 {
00106 #ifndef JA2
00107   if((Code < 0) || (!gfApplicationActive))
00108 #else
00109   if (Code < 0)
00110 #endif
00111   { // Do not handle this message, pass it on to another window
00112     return CallNextHookEx(ghKeyboardHook, Code, wParam, lParam);
00113   }
00114 
00115   if (lParam & TRANSITION_MASK)
00116   { // The key has been released
00117     KeyUp(wParam, lParam);
00118             //gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00119   }
00120   else
00121   { // Key was up
00122     KeyDown(wParam, lParam);
00123             gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00124   }
00125 
00126   return TRUE;
00127 }

00131 LRESULT CALLBACK MouseHandler(int Code, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00132 {
00133   UINT32 uiParam;
00134 
00135 #ifndef JA2
00136   if((Code < 0) || (!gfApplicationActive))
00137 #else
00138   if (Code < 0)
00139 #endif
00140   { // Do not handle this message, pass it on to another window
00141     return CallNextHookEx(ghMouseHook, Code, wParam, lParam);
00142   }
00143 
00144   switch (wParam)
00145   {
00146     case WM_LBUTTONDOWN
00147     : // Update the current mouse position
00148       gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00149       gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00150       uiParam = gusMouseYPos;
00151       uiParam = uiParam << 16;
00152       uiParam = uiParam | gusMouseXPos;
00153       // Update the button state
00154                   gfLeftButtonState = TRUE;
00155                   //Set that we have input
00156       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00157       // Trigger an input event
00158       QueueEvent(LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN, 0, uiParam);
00159           break;
00160     case WM_LBUTTONUP
00161     : // Update the current mouse position
00162       gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00163       gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00164       uiParam = gusMouseYPos;
00165       uiParam = uiParam << 16;
00166       uiParam = uiParam | gusMouseXPos;
00167       // Update the button state
00168       gfLeftButtonState = FALSE;
00169                   //Set that we have input
00170       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00171       // Trigger an input event
00172       QueueEvent(LEFT_BUTTON_UP, 0, uiParam);
00173       break;
00174     case WM_RBUTTONDOWN
00175     : // Update the current mouse position
00176       gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00177       gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00178       uiParam = gusMouseYPos;
00179       uiParam = uiParam << 16;
00180       uiParam = uiParam | gusMouseXPos;
00181       // Update the button state
00182       gfRightButtonState = TRUE;
00183                   //Set that we have input
00184       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00185       // Trigger an input event
00186       QueueEvent(RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN, 0, uiParam);
00187       break;
00188     case WM_RBUTTONUP
00189     : // Update the current mouse position
00190       gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00191       gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00192       uiParam = gusMouseYPos;
00193       uiParam = uiParam << 16;
00194       uiParam = uiParam | gusMouseXPos;
00195       // Update the button state
00196       gfRightButtonState = FALSE;
00197                   //Set that we have input
00198       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00199       // Trigger an input event
00200       QueueEvent(RIGHT_BUTTON_UP, 0, uiParam);
00201       break;
00202     case WM_MOUSEMOVE
00203     : // Update the current mouse position
00204       gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00205       gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00206       uiParam = gusMouseYPos;
00207       uiParam = uiParam << 16;
00208       uiParam = uiParam | gusMouseXPos;
00209       // Trigger an input event
00210       if (gfTrackMousePos == TRUE)
00211       {
00212         QueueEvent(MOUSE_POS, 0, uiParam);
00213       }
00214                   //Set that we have input
00215       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00216       break;
00217   }
00218   return TRUE;
00219 }

00223 // Wizardry mouse hander
00224 
00225 LRESULT CALLBACK MouseHandler(int Code, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam)
00226 {
00227 UINT32 uiParam;
00228 UINT32      uiXPos, uiYPos;
00229 RECT rcClient;
00230 BOOLEAN fOutsideClient=FALSE;
00231 static BOOLEAN fResizing=FALSE;
00232 LRESULT Result;
00233 
00234   uiXPos= (((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).x;
00235   uiYPos=   (((MOUSEHOOKSTRUCT *)lParam)->pt).y;
00236 
00237 
00238       if(!VideoIsFullScreen())
00239       {
00240             if(wParam==WM_NCLBUTTONDOWN)
00241                         fResizing=TRUE;
00242 
00243             VideoGetClientRect(&rcClient);
00244             if((uiXPos < (UINT32)rcClient.left) || (uiXPos > (UINT32)rcClient.right) || (uiYPos < (UINT32)rcClient.top) || (uiYPos > (UINT32)rcClient.bottom))
00245                   fOutsideClient=TRUE;
00246       }
00247 
00248   if((Code < 0) || (!gfApplicationActive) || fOutsideClient || fResizing)
00249   { // Do not handle this message, pass it on to another window
00250     Result = CallNextHookEx(ghMouseHook, Code, wParam, lParam);
00251 
00252             if((wParam==WM_LBUTTONUP) || (wParam==WM_NCLBUTTONUP))
00253                   fResizing=FALSE;
00254 
00255             return(Result);
00256   }
00257 
00258   switch (wParam)
00259   {
00260     case WM_LBUTTONUP:
00261     case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
00262     case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
00263     case WM_RBUTTONUP:
00264     case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00265                   if(VideoIsFullScreen())
00266                   {
00267             gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(uiXPos);
00268                 gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(uiYPos);
00269                   }
00270                   else
00271                   {
00272                 gusMouseXPos = (UINT16)(uiXPos-rcClient.left);
00273             gusMouseYPos = (UINT16)(uiYPos-rcClient.top);
00274                   }
00275               uiParam = (UINT32)gusMouseYPos<<16 | (UINT32)gusMouseXPos;
00276                   //Set that we have input
00277       gfSGPInputReceived =  TRUE;
00278           break;
00279   }
00280  
00281       if ( wParam == WM_MOUSEWHEEL )
00282       {
00283             return( FALSE );
00284       }
00285  
00286   switch (wParam)
00287   {
00288     case WM_LBUTTONDOWN:
00289                   gfLeftButtonState = TRUE;
00290       QueueEvent(LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN, 0, uiParam);
00291           break;
00292     case WM_LBUTTONUP:
00293                   gfLeftButtonState = FALSE;
00294       QueueEvent(LEFT_BUTTON_UP, 0, uiParam);
00295       break;
00296     case WM_RBUTTONDOWN:
00297       gfRightButtonState = TRUE;
00298       QueueEvent(RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN, 0, uiParam);
00299       break;
00300     case WM_RBUTTONUP:
00301       gfRightButtonState = FALSE;
00302       QueueEvent(RIGHT_BUTTON_UP, 0, uiParam);
00303       break;
00304     case WM_MOUSEMOVE:
00305       if(gfTrackMousePos)
00306         QueueEvent(MOUSE_POS, 0, uiParam);
00307       break;
00308   }
00309 
00310   return(TRUE);
00311 }

00313 #endif

00315 BOOLEAN InitializeInputManager(void)
00316 {
00317   // Link to debugger
00318   RegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_INPUT, "Input Manager");
00319   // Initialize the gfKeyState table to FALSE everywhere
00320   memset(gfKeyState, FALSE, 256);
00321   // Initialize the Event Queue
00322   gusQueueCount = 0;
00323   gusHeadIndex  = 0;
00324   gusTailIndex  = 0;
00325   // By default, we will not queue mousemove events
00326   gfTrackMousePos = FALSE;
00327   // Initialize other variables
00328   gfShiftState = FALSE;
00329   gfAltState   = FALSE;
00330   gfCtrlState  = FALSE;
00331   // Initialize variables pertaining to DOUBLE CLIK stuff
00332   gfTrackDblClick = TRUE;
00333   guiDoubleClkDelay = DBL_CLK_TIME;
00334   guiSingleClickTimer = 0;
00335   gfRecordedLeftButtonUp = FALSE;
00336   // Initialize variables pertaining to the button states
00337   gfLeftButtonState  = FALSE;
00338   gfRightButtonState = FALSE;
00339   // Initialize variables pertaining to the repeat mechanism
00340   guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
00341       guiRightButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
00342   // Set the mouse to the center of the screen
00343   gusMouseXPos = 320;
00344   gusMouseYPos = 240;
00345   // Initialize the string input mechanism
00346   gfCurrentStringInputState = FALSE;
00347   gpCurrentStringDescriptor = NULL;
00348   // Activate the hook functions for both keyboard and Mouse
00349   ghKeyboardHook = SetWindowsHookEx(WH_KEYBOARD, (HOOKPROC) KeyboardHandler, (HINSTANCE) 0, GetCurrentThreadId());
00350   DbgMessage(TOPIC_INPUT, DBG_LEVEL_2, String("Set keyboard hook returned %d", ghKeyboardHook));
00351 
00352   ghMouseHook = SetWindowsHookEx(WH_MOUSE, (HOOKPROC) MouseHandler, (HINSTANCE) 0, GetCurrentThreadId());
00353   DbgMessage(TOPIC_INPUT, DBG_LEVEL_2, String("Set mouse hook returned %d", ghMouseHook));
00354   return TRUE;
00355 }
00356 
00357 void ShutdownInputManager(void)
00358 { // There's very little to do when shutting down the input manager. In the future, this is where the keyboard and
00359   // mouse hooks will be destroyed
00360   UnRegisterDebugTopic(TOPIC_INPUT, "Input Manager");
00361   UnhookWindowsHookEx(ghKeyboardHook);
00362   UnhookWindowsHookEx(ghMouseHook);
00363 }
00364 
00365 void QueuePureEvent(UINT16 ubInputEvent, UINT32 usParam, UINT32 uiParam)
00366 {
00367   UINT32 uiTimer;
00368   UINT16 usKeyState;
00369 
00370   uiTimer = GetTickCount();
00371   usKeyState = gfShiftState | gfCtrlState | gfAltState;
00372 
00373   // Can we queue up one more event, if not, the event is lost forever
00374   if (gusQueueCount == 256)
00375   { // No more queue space
00376     return;
00377   }
00378 
00379   // Okey Dokey, we can queue up the event, so we do it
00380   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiTimeStamp = uiTimer;
00381   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usKeyState = usKeyState;
00382   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usEvent = ubInputEvent;
00383   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usParam = usParam;
00384   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiParam = uiParam;
00385 
00386   // Increment the number of items on the input queue
00387   gusQueueCount++;
00388 
00389   // Increment the gusTailIndex pointer
00390   if (gusTailIndex == 255)
00391   { // The gusTailIndex is about to wrap around the queue ring
00392     gusTailIndex = 0;
00393   }
00394   else
00395   { // We simply increment the gusTailIndex
00396     gusTailIndex++;
00397   }
00398 }
00399 
00400 void QueueEvent(UINT16 ubInputEvent, UINT32 usParam, UINT32 uiParam)
00401 {
00402   UINT32 uiTimer;
00403   UINT16 usKeyState;
00404 
00405   uiTimer = GetTickCount();
00406   usKeyState = gfShiftState | gfCtrlState | gfAltState;
00407 
00408   // Can we queue up one more event, if not, the event is lost forever
00409   if (gusQueueCount == 256)
00410   { // No more queue space
00411     return;
00412   }
00413 
00414   if (ubInputEvent == LEFT_BUTTON_DOWN)
00415   {
00416     guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer = uiTimer + BUTTON_REPEAT_TIMEOUT;
00417   }
00418 
00419   if (ubInputEvent == RIGHT_BUTTON_DOWN)
00420   {
00421     guiRightButtonRepeatTimer = uiTimer + BUTTON_REPEAT_TIMEOUT;
00422   }
00423 
00424   if (ubInputEvent == LEFT_BUTTON_UP)
00425   {
00426     guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
00427   }
00428 
00429   if (ubInputEvent == RIGHT_BUTTON_UP)
00430   {
00431     guiRightButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
00432   }
00433 
00434   if ( (ubInputEvent == LEFT_BUTTON_UP) )
00435   {
00436             // Do we have a double click
00437             if ( ( uiTimer - guiSingleClickTimer ) < DBL_CLK_TIME )
00438             {
00439                         guiSingleClickTimer = 0;
00440 
00441                         // Add a button up first...
00442                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiTimeStamp = uiTimer;
00443                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usKeyState = gusRecordedKeyState;
00444                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usEvent = LEFT_BUTTON_UP;
00445                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usParam = usParam;
00446                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiParam = uiParam;
00447 
00448                         // Increment the number of items on the input queue
00449                         gusQueueCount++;
00450 
00451                         // Increment the gusTailIndex pointer
00452                         if (gusTailIndex == 255)
00453                         { // The gusTailIndex is about to wrap around the queue ring
00454                               gusTailIndex = 0;
00455                         }
00456                         else
00457                         { // We simply increment the gusTailIndex
00458                               gusTailIndex++;
00459                         }
00460 
00461 
00462                         // Now do double click
00463                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiTimeStamp = uiTimer;
00464                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usKeyState = gusRecordedKeyState ;
00465                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usEvent = LEFT_BUTTON_DBL_CLK;
00466                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usParam = usParam;
00467                         gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiParam = uiParam;
00468 
00469                         // Increment the number of items on the input queue
00470                         gusQueueCount++;
00471 
00472                         // Increment the gusTailIndex pointer
00473                         if (gusTailIndex == 255)
00474                         { // The gusTailIndex is about to wrap around the queue ring
00475                               gusTailIndex = 0;
00476                         }
00477                         else
00478                         { // We simply increment the gusTailIndex
00479                               gusTailIndex++;
00480                         }
00481 
00482                         return;
00483             }
00484             else
00485             {
00486                   // Save time
00487                   guiSingleClickTimer = uiTimer;
00488             }
00489   }
00490 
00491   // Okey Dokey, we can queue up the event, so we do it
00492   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiTimeStamp = uiTimer;
00493   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usKeyState = usKeyState;
00494   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usEvent = ubInputEvent;
00495   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].usParam = usParam;
00496   gEventQueue[gusTailIndex].uiParam = uiParam;
00497 
00498   // Increment the number of items on the input queue
00499   gusQueueCount++;
00500 
00501   // Increment the gusTailIndex pointer
00502   if (gusTailIndex == 255)
00503   { // The gusTailIndex is about to wrap around the queue ring
00504     gusTailIndex = 0;
00505   }
00506   else
00507   { // We simply increment the gusTailIndex
00508     gusTailIndex++;
00509   }
00510 }
00511 
00512 BOOLEAN DequeueSpecificEvent(InputAtom *Event, UINT32 uiMaskFlags )
00513 {
00514   // Is there an event to dequeue
00515   if (gusQueueCount > 0)
00516   {
00517             memcpy( Event, &( gEventQueue[gusHeadIndex] ), sizeof( InputAtom ) );
00518 
00519             // Check if it has the masks!
00520             if ( ( Event->usEvent & uiMaskFlags ) )
00521             {
00522                   return( DequeueEvent( Event) );
00523             }
00524       }
00525 
00526       return( FALSE );
00527 }
00528 
00529 BOOLEAN DequeueEvent(InputAtom *Event)
00530 {
00531       HandleSingleClicksAndButtonRepeats( );
00532 
00533   // Is there an event to dequeue
00534   if (gusQueueCount > 0)
00535   {
00536             // We have an event, so we dequeue it
00537             memcpy( Event, &( gEventQueue[gusHeadIndex] ), sizeof( InputAtom ) );
00538 
00539             if (gusHeadIndex == 255)
00540             {
00541                   gusHeadIndex = 0;
00542             }
00543             else
00544             {
00545                   gusHeadIndex++;
00546             }
00547 
00548             // Decrement the number of items on the input queue
00549             gusQueueCount--;
00550 
00551             // dequeued an event, return TRUE
00552             return TRUE;
00553   }
00554       else
00555       {
00556             // No events to dequeue, return FALSE
00557             return FALSE;
00558       }
00559 }
00560 
00561 void KeyChange(UINT32 usParam, UINT32 uiParam, UINT8 ufKeyState)
00562 {
00563   UINT32 ubKey;
00564   UINT16 ubChar;
00565   POINT  MousePos;
00566   UINT32 uiTmpLParam;
00567 
00568   if ((usParam >= 96)&&(usParam <= 110))
00569   { // Well this could be a NUMPAD character imitating the center console characters (when NUMLOCK is OFF). Well we
00570     // gotta find out what was pressed and translate it to the actual physical key (i.e. if we think that HOME was
00571     // pressed but NUM_7 was pressed, the we translate the key into NUM_7
00572     switch(usParam)
00573     { case 96 // NUM_0
00574       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 82)
00575         { // Well its the NUM_9 key and not actually the PGUP key
00576           ubKey = 223;
00577         }
00578         else
00579         { // NOP, its the PGUP key all right
00580           ubKey = usParam;
00581         }
00582         break;
00583       case 110 // NUM_PERIOD
00584       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 83)
00585         { // Well its the NUM_3 key and not actually the PGDN key
00586           ubKey = 224;
00587         }
00588         else
00589         { // NOP, its the PGDN key all right
00590           ubKey = usParam;
00591         }
00592         break;
00593       case 97 // NUM_1
00594       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 79)
00595         { // Well its the NUM_1 key and not actually the END key
00596           ubKey = 225;
00597         }
00598         else
00599         { // NOP, its the END key all right
00600           ubKey = usParam;
00601         }
00602         break;
00603       case 98 // NUM_2
00604       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 80)
00605         { // Well its the NUM_7 key and not actually the HOME key
00606           ubKey = 226;
00607         }
00608         else
00609         { // NOP, its the HOME key all right
00610           ubKey = usParam;
00611         }
00612         break;
00613       case 99 // NUM_3
00614       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 81)
00615         { // Well its the NUM_4 key and not actually the LARROW key
00616           ubKey = 227;
00617         }
00618         else
00619         { // NOP, it's the LARROW key all right
00620           ubKey = usParam;
00621         }
00622         break;
00623       case 100 // NUM_4
00624       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 75)
00625         { // Well its the NUM_8 key and not actually the UPARROW key
00626           ubKey = 228;
00627         }
00628         else
00629         { // NOP, it's the UPARROW key all right
00630           ubKey = usParam;
00631         }
00632         break;
00633       case 101 // NUM_5
00634       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 76)
00635         { // Well its the NUM_6 key and not actually the RARROW key
00636           ubKey = 229;
00637         }
00638         else
00639         { // NOP, it's the RARROW key all right
00640           ubKey = usParam;
00641         }
00642         break;
00643       case 102 // NUM_6
00644       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 77)
00645         { // Well its the NUM_2 key and not actually the DNARROW key
00646           ubKey = 230;
00647         }
00648         else
00649         { // NOP, it's the DNARROW key all right
00650           ubKey = usParam;
00651         }
00652         break;
00653       case 103 // NUM_7
00654       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 71)
00655         { // Well its the NUM_0 key and not actually the INSERT key
00656           ubKey = 231;
00657         }
00658         else
00659         { // NOP, it's the INSERT key all right
00660           ubKey = usParam;
00661         }
00662         break;
00663       case 104 // NUM_8
00664       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 72)
00665         { // Well its the NUM_PERIOD key and not actually the DELETE key
00666           ubKey = 232;
00667         }
00668         else
00669         { // NOP, it's the DELETE key all right
00670           ubKey = usParam;
00671         }
00672         break;
00673       case 105 // NUM_9
00674       : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 73)
00675         { // Well its the NUM_PERIOD key and not actually the DELETE key
00676           ubKey = 233;
00677         }
00678         else
00679         { // NOP, it's the DELETE key all right
00680           ubKey = usParam;
00681         }
00682         break;
00683       default
00684       : ubKey = usParam;
00685         break;
00686     }
00687   }
00688   else
00689   {
00690     if ((usParam >= 33)&&(usParam <= 46))
00691     { // Well this could be a NUMPAD character imitating the center console characters (when NUMLOCK is OFF). Well we
00692       // gotta find out what was pressed and translate it to the actual physical key (i.e. if we think that HOME was
00693       // pressed but NUM_7 was pressed, the we translate the key into NUM_7
00694       switch(usParam)
00695       { case 45 // NUM_0
00696         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 82)
00697           { // Is it the NUM_0 key or the INSERT key
00698             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00699             { // It's the INSERT key
00700               ubKey = 245;
00701             }
00702             else
00703             { // Is the NUM_0 key with NUM lock off
00704               ubKey = 234;
00705             }
00706           }
00707           else
00708           {
00709             ubKey = usParam;
00710           }
00711           break;
00712         case 46 // NUM_PERIOD
00713         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 83)
00714           { // Is it the NUM_PERIOD key or the DEL key
00715             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00716             { // It's the DELETE key
00717               ubKey = 246;
00718             }
00719             else
00720             { // Is the NUM_PERIOD key with NUM lock off
00721               ubKey = 235;
00722             }
00723           }
00724           else
00725           {
00726             ubKey = usParam;
00727           }
00728           break;
00729         case 35 // NUM_1
00730         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 79)
00731           { // Is it the NUM_1 key or the END key
00732             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00733             { // It's the END key
00734               ubKey = 247;
00735             }
00736             else
00737             { // Is the NUM_1 key with NUM lock off
00738               ubKey = 236;
00739             }
00740           }
00741           else
00742           {
00743             ubKey = usParam;
00744           }
00745           break;
00746         case 40 // NUM_2
00747         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 80)
00748           { // Is it the NUM_2 key or the DOWN key
00749             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00750             { // It's the DOWN key
00751               ubKey = 248;
00752             }
00753             else
00754             { // Is the NUM_2 key with NUM lock off
00755               ubKey = 237;
00756             }
00757           }
00758           else
00759           {
00760             ubKey = usParam;
00761           }
00762           break;
00763         case 34 // NUM_3
00764         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 81)
00765           { // Is it the NUM_3 key or the PGDN key
00766             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00767             { // It's the PGDN key
00768               ubKey = 249;
00769             }
00770             else
00771             { // Is the NUM_3 key with NUM lock off
00772               ubKey = 238;
00773             }
00774           }
00775           else
00776           {
00777             ubKey = usParam;
00778           }
00779           break;
00780         case 37 // NUM_4
00781         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 75)
00782           { // Is it the NUM_4 key or the LEFT key
00783             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00784             { // It's the LEFT key
00785               ubKey = 250;
00786             }
00787             else
00788             { // Is the NUM_4 key with NUM lock off
00789               ubKey = 239;
00790             }
00791           }
00792           else
00793           {
00794             ubKey = usParam;
00795           }
00796           break;
00797         case 39 // NUM_6
00798         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 77)
00799           { // Is it the NUM_6 key or the RIGHT key
00800             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00801             { // It's the RIGHT key
00802               ubKey = 251;
00803             }
00804             else
00805             { // Is the NUM_6 key with NUM lock off
00806               ubKey = 241;
00807             }
00808           }
00809           else
00810           {
00811             ubKey = usParam;
00812           }
00813           break;
00814         case 36 // NUM_7
00815         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 71)
00816           { // Is it the NUM_7 key or the HOME key
00817             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00818             { // It's the HOME key
00819               ubKey = 252;
00820             }
00821             else
00822             { // Is the NUM_7 key with NUM lock off
00823               ubKey = 242;
00824             }
00825           }
00826           else
00827           {
00828             ubKey = usParam;
00829           }
00830           break;
00831         case 38 // NUM_8
00832         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 72)
00833           { // Is it the NUM_8 key or the UP key
00834             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00835             { // It's the UP key
00836               ubKey = 253;
00837             }
00838             else
00839             { // Is the NUM_8 key with NUM lock off
00840               ubKey = 243;
00841             }
00842           }
00843           else
00844           {
00845             ubKey = usParam;
00846           }
00847           break;
00848         case 33 // NUM_9
00849         : if (((uiParam & SCAN_CODE_MASK) >> 16) == 73)
00850           { // Is it the NUM_9 key or the PGUP key
00851             if (((uiParam & EXT_CODE_MASK) >> 17) != 0)
00852             { // It's the PGUP key
00853               ubKey = 254;
00854             }
00855             else
00856             { // Is the NUM_9 key with NUM lock off
00857               ubKey = 244;
00858             }
00859           }
00860           else
00861           {
00862             ubKey = usParam;
00863           }
00864           break;
00865         default
00866         : ubKey = usParam;
00867           break;
00868       }
00869     }
00870     else
00871     {
00872       if (usParam == 12)
00873       { // NUM_5 with NUM_LOCK off
00874         ubKey = 240;
00875       }
00876       else
00877       { // Normal key
00878         ubKey = usParam;
00879       }
00880     }
00881   }
00882 
00883       // Find ucChar by translating ubKey using the gsKeyTranslationTable. If the SHIFT, ALT or CTRL key are down, then
00884   // the index into the translation table us changed from ubKey to ubKey+256, ubKey+512 and ubKey+768 respectively
00885   if (gfShiftState == TRUE)
00886   { // SHIFT is pressed, hence we add 256 to ubKey before translation to ubChar
00887     ubChar = gsKeyTranslationTable[ubKey+256];
00888   }
00889   else
00890   {
00891             //
00892             // Even though gfAltState is checked as if it was a BOOLEAN, it really contains 0x02, which
00893             // is NOT == to true.  This is broken, however to fix it would break Ja2 and Wizardry.
00894             // The same thing goes for gfCtrlState and gfShiftState, howver gfShiftState is assigned 0x01 which IS == to TRUE.
00895             // Just something i found, and thought u should know about.  DF.
00896             //
00897 
00898     if( gfAltState == TRUE )
00899     { // ALT is pressed, hence ubKey is multiplied by 3 before translation to ubChar
00900       ubChar = gsKeyTranslationTable[ubKey+512];
00901     }
00902     else
00903     {
00904       if (gfCtrlState == TRUE)
00905       { // CTRL is pressed, hence ubKey is multiplied by 4 before translation to ubChar
00906         ubChar = gsKeyTranslationTable[ubKey+768];
00907       }
00908       else
00909       { // None of the SHIFT, ALT or CTRL are pressed hence we have a default translation of ubKey
00910         ubChar = gsKeyTranslationTable[ubKey];
00911       }
00912     }
00913   }
00914 
00915   GetCursorPos(&MousePos);
00916   uiTmpLParam = ((MousePos.y << 16) & 0xffff0000) | (MousePos.x & 0x0000ffff);
00917 
00918   if (ufKeyState == TRUE)
00919   { // Key has been PRESSED
00920     // Find out if the key is already pressed and if not, queue an event and update the gfKeyState array
00921     if (gfKeyState[ubKey] == FALSE)
00922     { // Well the key has just been pressed, therefore we queue up and event and update the gsKeyState
00923       if (gfCurrentStringInputState == FALSE)
00924       {
00925         // There is no string input going on right now, so we queue up the event
00926         gfKeyState[ubKey] = TRUE;
00927         QueueEvent(KEY_DOWN, ubChar, uiTmpLParam);
00928                   }
00929       else
00930       { // There is a current input string which will capture this event
00931         RedirectToString(ubChar);
00932         DbgMessage(TOPIC_INPUT, DBG_LEVEL_0, String("Pressed character %d (%d)", ubChar, ubKey));
00933       }
00934     }
00935     else
00936     { // Well the key gets repeated
00937       if (gfCurrentStringInputState == FALSE)
00938       { // There is no string input going on right now, so we queue up the event
00939         QueueEvent(KEY_REPEAT, ubChar, uiTmpLParam);
00940       }
00941       else
00942       { // There is a current input string which will capture this event
00943         RedirectToString(ubChar);
00944       }
00945     }
00946   }
00947   else
00948   { // Key has been RELEASED
00949     // Find out if the key is already pressed and if so, queue an event and update the gfKeyState array
00950     if (gfKeyState[ubKey] == TRUE)
00951     { // Well the key has just been pressed, therefore we queue up and event and update the gsKeyState
00952       gfKeyState[ubKey] = FALSE;
00953       QueueEvent(KEY_UP, ubChar, uiTmpLParam);
00954     }
00955             //else if the alt tab key was pressed
00956             else if( ubChar == TAB && gfAltState )
00957             {
00958                   // therefore minimize the application
00959                   ShowWindow( ghWindow, SW_MINIMIZE ); 
00960       gfKeyState[ ALT ] = FALSE;
00961                   gfAltState = FALSE;
00962             }
00963   }
00964 }
00965 
00966 void KeyDown(UINT32 usParam, UINT32 uiParam)
00967 { // Are we PRESSING down one of SHIFT, ALT or CTRL ???
00968   if (usParam == 16)
00969   { // SHIFT key is PRESSED
00970     gfShiftState = SHIFT_DOWN;
00971     gfKeyState[16] = TRUE;
00972   }
00973   else
00974   {
00975     if (usParam == 17)
00976     { // CTRL key is PRESSED
00977       gfCtrlState = CTRL_DOWN;
00978       gfKeyState[17] = TRUE;
00979     }
00980     else
00981     {
00982       if (usParam == 18)
00983       { // ALT key is pressed
00984         gfAltState = ALT_DOWN;
00985         gfKeyState[18] = TRUE;
00986       }
00987       else
00988       {
00989         if (usParam == SNAPSHOT)
00990         {
00991           //PrintScreen();
00992                               // DB Done in the KeyUp function
00993                               // this used to be keyed to SCRL_LOCK
00994                               // which I believe Luis gave the wrong value
00995         }
00996         else
00997         {
00998           // No special keys have been pressed
00999           // Call KeyChange() and pass TRUE to indicate key has been PRESSED and not RELEASED
01000           KeyChange(usParam, uiParam, TRUE);
01001         }
01002       }
01003     }
01004   }
01005 }
01006 
01007 void KeyUp(UINT32 usParam, UINT32 uiParam)
01008 { // Are we RELEASING one of SHIFT, ALT or CTRL ???
01009   if (usParam == 16)
01010   { // SHIFT key is RELEASED
01011     gfShiftState = FALSE;
01012     gfKeyState[16] = FALSE;
01013   }
01014   else
01015   {
01016     if (usParam == 17)
01017     { // CTRL key is RELEASED
01018       gfCtrlState = FALSE;
01019       gfKeyState[17] = FALSE;
01020     }
01021     else
01022     {
01023       if (usParam == 18)
01024       { // ALT key is RELEASED
01025         gfAltState = FALSE;
01026         gfKeyState[18] = FALSE;
01027       }
01028       else
01029       {
01030         if (usParam == SNAPSHOT)
01031         {
01032                               // DB this used to be keyed to SCRL_LOCK
01033                               // which I believe Luis gave the wrong value
01034                               //#ifndef JA2
01035                               if (_KeyDown(CTRL))
01036                                     VideoCaptureToggle();
01037                               else
01038                               //#endif
01039                                     PrintScreen();
01040         }
01041         else
01042         {
01043                               // No special keys have been pressed
01044                               // Call KeyChange() and pass FALSE to indicate key has been PRESSED and not RELEASED
01045                               KeyChange(usParam, uiParam, FALSE);
01046         }
01047       }
01048     }
01049   }
01050 }
01051 
01052 void EnableDoubleClk(void)
01053 {
01054       // Obsolete
01055 }
01056 
01057 void DisableDoubleClk(void)
01058 {
01059       // Obsolete
01060 }
01061 
01062 void GetMousePos(SGPPoint *Point)
01063 {
01064   POINT MousePos;
01065 
01066   GetCursorPos(&MousePos);
01067 
01068   Point->iX = (UINT32) MousePos.x;
01069   Point->iY = (UINT32) MousePos.y;
01070 
01071   return;
01072 }
01073 
01074 // These functions will be used for string input
01075 
01076 // Since all string input will have to be handle by reentrant capable functions (since we must attend
01077 // to windows messaging as well as network traffic related issues), whenever there is ongoing string input
01078 // going on, we must use InitStringInput() and HandleStringInput() to get the job done. HandleStringInput()
01079 // will return TRUE as long as the string input is going on, and FALSE when its done
01080 //
01081 // During string input, all keyboard are rerouted to the string and hence are not queued up on the
01082 // event queue or registered in the state table. Also note that several string inputs can occur
01083 // at the same time. Use the SetStringFocus() function to manager the focus for multiple
01084 // string inputs
01085 
01086 StringInput *InitStringInput(UINT16 *pInputString, UINT16 usLength, UINT16 *pFilter)
01087 {
01088   StringInput *pStringDescriptor;
01089 
01090   if ((pStringDescriptor = (StringInput *) MemAlloc(sizeof(StringInput))) == NULL)
01091   {
01092     //
01093     // Hum we failed to allocate memory for the string descriptor
01094     //
01095 
01096     DbgMessage(TOPIC_INPUT, DBG_LEVEL_1, "Failed to allocate memory for string descriptor");
01097     return NULL;
01098   }
01099   else
01100   {
01101     if ((pStringDescriptor->pOriginalString = (UINT16 *) MemAlloc(usLength * 2)) == NULL)
01102     {
01103       //
01104       // free up structure before aborting
01105       //
01106 
01107       MemFree(pStringDescriptor);
01108       DbgMessage(TOPIC_INPUT, DBG_LEVEL_1, "Failed to allocate memory for string duplicate");
01109       return NULL;
01110     }
01111 
01112     memcpy(pStringDescriptor->pOriginalString, pInputString, usLength * 2);
01113 
01114     pStringDescriptor->pString = pInputString;
01115     pStringDescriptor->pFilter = pFilter;
01116     pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength = usLength;
01117     pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = 0;
01118     pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength = 0;
01119     while ((pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset < pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength)&&(*(pStringDescriptor->pString + pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset) != 0))
01120     {
01121       //
01122       // Find the last character in the string
01123       //
01124 
01125       pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset++;
01126       pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength++;
01127     }
01128 
01129     if (pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset == pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength)
01130     {
01131       //
01132       // Hum the current string has no null terminator. Invalidate the string and
01133       // start from scratch
01134       //
01135 
01136       memset(pStringDescriptor->pString, 0, usLength * 2);
01137       pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = 0;
01138       pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength = 0;
01139     }
01140 
01141     pStringDescriptor->fInsertMode = FALSE;
01142     pStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01143     pStringDescriptor->pPreviousString = NULL;
01144     pStringDescriptor->pNextString = NULL;
01145 
01146     return pStringDescriptor;
01147   }
01148 }
01149 
01150 void    LinkPreviousString(StringInput *pCurrentString, StringInput *pPreviousString)
01151 {
01152   if (pCurrentString != NULL)
01153   {
01154     if (pCurrentString->pPreviousString != NULL)
01155     {
01156       pCurrentString->pPreviousString->pNextString = NULL;
01157     }
01158 
01159     pCurrentString->pPreviousString = pPreviousString;
01160 
01161     if (pPreviousString != NULL)
01162     {
01163       pPreviousString->pNextString = pCurrentString;
01164     }
01165   }
01166 }
01167 
01168 void    LinkNextString(StringInput *pCurrentString, StringInput *pNextString)
01169 {
01170   if (pCurrentString != NULL)
01171   {
01172     if (pCurrentString->pNextString != NULL)
01173     {
01174       pCurrentString->pNextString->pPreviousString = NULL;
01175     }
01176 
01177     pCurrentString->pNextString = pNextString;
01178 
01179     if (pNextString != NULL)
01180     {
01181       pNextString->pPreviousString = pCurrentString;
01182     }
01183   }
01184 }
01185 
01186 BOOLEAN CharacterIsValid(UINT16 usCharacter, UINT16 *pFilter)
01187 {
01188   UINT32 uiIndex, uiEndIndex;
01189 
01190   if (pFilter != NULL)
01191   {
01192     uiEndIndex = *pFilter;
01193         for (uiIndex = 1; uiIndex <= *pFilter; uiIndex++)
01194         {
01195       if (usCharacter == *(pFilter + uiIndex))
01196       {
01197         return TRUE;
01198       }
01199         }
01200     return FALSE;
01201   }
01202 
01203   return TRUE;
01204 }
01205 
01206 void    RedirectToString(UINT16 usInputCharacter)
01207 {
01208   UINT16 usIndex;
01209 
01210   if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor != NULL)
01211   {
01212     // Handle the new character input
01213     switch (usInputCharacter)
01214     {
01215       case ENTER
01216       : // ENTER is pressed, the last character field should be set to ENTER
01217         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString != NULL)
01218         {
01219           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01220           gpCurrentStringDescriptor = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString;
01221           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01222           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01223         }
01224         else
01225         {
01226           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01227           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01228           gfCurrentStringInputState = FALSE;
01229         }
01230         break;
01231       case ESC
01232       : // ESC was pressed, the last character field should be set to ESC
01233         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01234         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01235         gfCurrentStringInputState = FALSE;
01236         break;
01237       case SHIFT_TAB
01238       : // TAB was pressed, the last character field should be set to TAB
01239         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pPreviousString != NULL)
01240         {
01241           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01242           gpCurrentStringDescriptor = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pPreviousString;
01243           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01244           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01245         }
01246         break;
01247       case TAB
01248       : // TAB was pressed, the last character field should be set to TAB
01249         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString != NULL)
01250         {
01251           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01252           gpCurrentStringDescriptor = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString;
01253           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01254           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01255         }
01256         break;
01257       case UPARROW
01258       : // The UPARROW was pressed, the last character field should be set to UPARROW
01259         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pPreviousString != NULL)
01260         {
01261           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01262           gpCurrentStringDescriptor = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pPreviousString;
01263           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01264           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01265         }
01266         break;
01267       case DNARROW
01268       : // The DNARROW was pressed, the last character field should be set to DNARROW
01269         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString != NULL)
01270         {
01271           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01272           gpCurrentStringDescriptor = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pNextString;
01273           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01274           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01275         }
01276         break;
01277       case LEFTARROW
01278       : // The LEFTARROW was pressed, move one character to the left
01279         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset > 0)
01280         { // Decrement the offset
01281           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset--;
01282         }
01283         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01284         break;
01285       case RIGHTARROW
01286       : // The RIGHTARROW was pressed, move one character to the right
01287         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset < gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength)
01288         { // Ok we can move the cursor one up without going past the end of string
01289           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset++;
01290         }
01291         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01292         break;
01293       case BACKSPACE
01294       : // Delete the character preceding the cursor
01295         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset > 0)
01296         { // Ok, we are not at the beginning of the string, so we may proceed
01297           for (usIndex = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset; usIndex <= gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength; usIndex++)
01298           { // Shift the characters one at a time
01299             *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex - 1) = *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex);
01300           }
01301           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset--;
01302           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength--;
01303         }
01304 
01305         break;
01306       case DEL
01307       : // Delete the character which follows the cursor
01308         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset < gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength)
01309         { // Ok we are not at the end of the string, so we may proceed
01310           for (usIndex = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset; usIndex < gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength; usIndex++)
01311           { // Shift the characters one at a time
01312             *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex) = *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex + 1);
01313           }
01314           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength--;
01315         }
01316         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01317         break;
01318       case INSERT
01319       : // Toggle insert mode
01320         if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fInsertMode == TRUE)
01321         {
01322           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fInsertMode = FALSE;
01323         }
01324         else
01325         {
01326           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fInsertMode = TRUE;
01327         }
01328         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01329         break;
01330       case HOME
01331       : // Go to the beginning of the input string
01332         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = 0 ;
01333         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01334         break;
01335 #ifndef JA2
01336 // Stupid definition causes problems with headers that use the keyword END -- DB
01337             case KEY_END
01338 #else
01339             case END
01340 #endif
01341       : // Go to the end of the input string
01342         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength;
01343         gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01344         break;
01345       default
01346       : //
01347         // normal input
01348         //
01349         if (CharacterIsValid(usInputCharacter, gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pFilter) == TRUE)
01350         {
01351           if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fInsertMode == TRUE)
01352           { // Before we can shift characters for the insert, we must make sure we have the space
01353             if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength < (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength - 1))
01354             { // Before we can add a new character we must shift existing ones to for the insert
01355               for (usIndex = gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength; usIndex > gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset; usIndex--)
01356               { // Shift the characters one at a time
01357                 *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex) = *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex - 1);
01358               }
01359               // Ok now we introduce the new character
01360               *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + usIndex) = usInputCharacter;
01361               gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset++;
01362               gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength++;
01363             }
01364           }
01365           else
01366           {
01367             // Ok, add character to string (by overwriting)
01368             if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset < (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength - 1))
01369             { // Ok, we have not exceeded the maximum number of characters yet
01370               *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset) = usInputCharacter;
01371               gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset++;
01372             }
01373             // Did we push back the current string length (i.e. add character to end of string)
01374             if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset > gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength)
01375             { // Add a NULL character
01376               *(gpCurrentStringDescriptor->pString + gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usStringOffset) = 0;
01377               gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength++;
01378             }
01379           }
01380           gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = usInputCharacter;
01381         }
01382         break;
01383     }
01384   }
01385 }
01386 
01387 UINT16 GetStringInputState(void)
01388 {
01389   if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor != NULL)
01390   {
01391     return gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter;
01392   }
01393   else
01394   {
01395     return 0;
01396   }
01397 }
01398 
01399 BOOLEAN StringInputHasFocus(void)
01400 {
01401   return gfCurrentStringInputState;
01402 }
01403 
01404 BOOLEAN SetStringFocus(StringInput *pStringDescriptor)
01405 {
01406   if (pStringDescriptor != NULL)
01407   {
01408     if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor != NULL)
01409     {
01410       gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01411     }
01412     // Ok overide current entry
01413     gfCurrentStringInputState = TRUE;
01414     gpCurrentStringDescriptor = pStringDescriptor;
01415     gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = TRUE;
01416     gpCurrentStringDescriptor->usLastCharacter = 0;
01417     return TRUE;
01418   }
01419   else
01420   {
01421     if (gpCurrentStringDescriptor != NULL)
01422     {
01423       gpCurrentStringDescriptor->fFocus = FALSE;
01424     }
01425     // Ok overide current entry
01426     gfCurrentStringInputState = FALSE;
01427     gpCurrentStringDescriptor = NULL;
01428     return TRUE;
01429   }
01430 }
01431 
01432 UINT16 GetCursorPositionInString(StringInput *pStringDescriptor)
01433 {
01434   return pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset;
01435 }
01436 
01437 BOOLEAN StringHasFocus(StringInput *pStringDescriptor)
01438 {
01439   if (pStringDescriptor != NULL)
01440   {
01441     return pStringDescriptor->fFocus;
01442   }
01443   else
01444   {
01445     return FALSE;
01446   }
01447 }
01448 
01449 void RestoreString(StringInput *pStringDescriptor)
01450 {
01451   memcpy(pStringDescriptor->pString, pStringDescriptor->pOriginalString, pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength * 2);
01452 
01453   pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = 0;
01454   pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength = 0;
01455   while ((pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset < pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength)&&(*(pStringDescriptor->pString + pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset) != 0))
01456   {
01457     //
01458     // Find the last character in the string
01459     //
01460 
01461     pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset++;
01462     pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength++;
01463   }
01464 
01465   if (pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset == pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength)
01466   {
01467     //
01468     // Hum the current string has no null terminator. Invalidate the string and
01469     // start from scratch
01470     //
01471     memset(pStringDescriptor->pString, 0, pStringDescriptor->usMaxStringLength * 2);
01472     pStringDescriptor->usStringOffset = 0;
01473     pStringDescriptor->usCurrentStringLength = 0;
01474   }
01475 
01476   pStringDescriptor->fInsertMode = FALSE;
01477 }
01478 
01479 void EndStringInput(StringInput *pStringDescriptor)
01480 { // Make sure we have a valid pStringDescriptor
01481   if (pStringDescriptor != NULL)
01482   { // make sure the gpCurrentStringDescriptor is NULL if necessary
01483     if (pStringDescriptor == gpCurrentStringDescriptor)
01484     {
01485       gpCurrentStringDescriptor = NULL;
01486       gfCurrentStringInputState = FALSE;
01487     }
01488     // Make sure we have a valid string within the string descriptor
01489     if (pStringDescriptor->pOriginalString != NULL)
01490     { // free up the string
01491       MemFree(pStringDescriptor->pOriginalString);
01492     }
01493     // free up the descriptor
01494     MemFree(pStringDescriptor);
01495   }
01496 }

01504 void RestrictMouseToXYXY(UINT16 usX1, UINT16 usY1, UINT16 usX2, UINT16 usY2)
01505 {
01506       SGPRect TempRect;
01507 
01508       TempRect.iLeft   = usX1;
01509       TempRect.iTop    = usY1;
01510       TempRect.iRight  = usX2;
01511       TempRect.iBottom = usY2;
01512 
01513       RestrictMouseCursor(&TempRect);
01514 }
01515 
01516 void RestrictMouseCursor(SGPRect *pRectangle)
01517 {
01518   // Make a copy of our rect....
01519   memcpy( &gCursorClipRect, pRectangle, sizeof( gCursorClipRect ) );
01520   ClipCursor((RECT *)pRectangle);
01521       fCursorWasClipped = TRUE;
01522 }
01523 
01524 void FreeMouseCursor(void)
01525 {
01526   ClipCursor(NULL);
01527       fCursorWasClipped = FALSE;
01528 }
01529 
01530 void RestoreCursorClipRect( void )
01531 {
01532   if ( fCursorWasClipped )
01533   {
01534     ClipCursor( &gCursorClipRect );
01535   }
01536 }
01537 
01538 void GetRestrictedClipCursor( SGPRect *pRectangle )
01539 {
01540       GetClipCursor((RECT *) pRectangle );
01541 }
01542 
01543 BOOLEAN IsCursorRestricted( void )
01544 {
01545       return( fCursorWasClipped );
01546 }
01547 
01548 void SimulateMouseMovement( UINT32 uiNewXPos, UINT32 uiNewYPos )
01549 {
01550       FLOAT flNewXPos, flNewYPos;
01551 
01552       // Wizardry NOTE: This function currently doesn't quite work right for in any Windows resolution other than 640x480.
01553       // mouse_event() uses your current Windows resolution to calculate the resulting x,y coordinates.  So in order to get
01554       // the right coordinates, you'd have to find out the current Windows resolution through a system call, and then do:
01555       //          uiNewXPos = uiNewXPos * SCREEN_WIDTH  / WinScreenResX;
01556       //          uiNewYPos = uiNewYPos * SCREEN_HEIGHT / WinScreenResY;
01557       //
01558       // JA2 doesn't have this problem, 'cause they use DirectDraw calls that change the Windows resolution properly.
01559       //
01560       // Alex Meduna, Dec. 3, 1997
01561 
01562       // Adjust coords based on our resolution
01563       flNewXPos = ( (FLOAT)uiNewXPos / SCREEN_WIDTH ) * 65536;
01564       flNewYPos = ( (FLOAT)uiNewYPos / SCREEN_HEIGHT ) * 65536;
01565 
01566       mouse_event( MOUSEEVENTF_ABSOLUTE | MOUSEEVENTF_MOVE, (UINT32)flNewXPos, (UINT32)flNewYPos, 0, 0 );
01567 }
01568 
01569 
01570 
01571 BOOLEAN InputEventInside(InputAtom *Event, UINT32 uiX1, UINT32 uiY1, UINT32 uiX2, UINT32 uiY2)
01572 {
01573   UINT32 uiEventX, uiEventY;
01574 
01575   uiEventX = _EvMouseX(Event);
01576   uiEventY = _EvMouseY(Event);
01577 
01578   return((uiEventX >= uiX1) && (uiEventX <= uiX2) && (uiEventY >= uiY1) && (uiEventY <= uiY2));
01579 }
01580 
01581 
01582 void DequeueAllKeyBoardEvents()
01583 {
01584       InputAtom  InputEvent;
01585       MSG                      KeyMessage;
01586 
01587 
01588       //dequeue all the events waiting in the windows queue
01589       while( PeekMessage( &KeyMessage, ghWindow, WM_KEYFIRST, WM_KEYLAST, PM_REMOVE ) );
01590 
01591       //Deque all the events waiting in the SGP queue
01592       while (DequeueEvent(&InputEvent) == TRUE)
01593   {
01594             //dont do anything
01595       }
01596 }

01598 
01599 
01600 void HandleSingleClicksAndButtonRepeats( void )
01601 {
01602   UINT32 uiTimer;
01603 
01604 
01605   uiTimer = GetTickCount();
01606 
01607   // Is there a LEFT mouse button repeat
01608   if (gfLeftButtonState)
01609   {
01610     if ((guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer > 0)&&(guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer <= uiTimer))
01611     {
01612       UINT32 uiTmpLParam;
01613       POINT  MousePos;
01614 
01615       GetCursorPos(&MousePos);
01616       uiTmpLParam = ((MousePos.y << 16) & 0xffff0000) | (MousePos.x & 0x0000ffff);
01617       QueueEvent(LEFT_BUTTON_REPEAT, 0, uiTmpLParam);
01618       guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer = uiTimer + BUTTON_REPEAT_TIME;
01619     }
01620   }
01621   else
01622   {
01623     guiLeftButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
01624   }
01625 
01626 
01627       // Is there a RIGHT mouse button repeat
01628       if (gfRightButtonState)
01629   {
01630     if ((guiRightButtonRepeatTimer > 0)&&(guiRightButtonRepeatTimer <= uiTimer))
01631     {
01632       UINT32 uiTmpLParam;
01633       POINT  MousePos;
01634 
01635       GetCursorPos(&MousePos);
01636       uiTmpLParam = ((MousePos.y << 16) & 0xffff0000) | (MousePos.x & 0x0000ffff);
01637       QueueEvent(RIGHT_BUTTON_REPEAT, 0, uiTmpLParam);
01638       guiRightButtonRepeatTimer = uiTimer + BUTTON_REPEAT_TIME;
01639     }
01640   }
01641   else
01642   {
01643     guiRightButtonRepeatTimer = 0;
01644   }
01645 }
01646 
01647 
01648 INT16 GetMouseWheelDeltaValue( UINT32 wParam )
01649 {
01650       INT16 sDelta = HIWORD( wParam );
01651 
01652       return( sDelta / WHEEL_DELTA );
01653 }
